verses.verse: אֵיכָ֣ה׀ <S%H349><s%> 'ei-Chah how יָשְׁבָ֣ה <S%H3427><s%> ya-she-Vah sit בָדָ֗ד <S%H910><s%> va-Dad, solitary הָעִיר֙ <S%H5892><s%> ha-'Ir How doth the city רַבָּ֣תִי <S%H7227><s%> rab-Ba-ti [that was] full עָ֔ם <S%H5971><s%> 'Am, of people הָיְתָ֖ה <S%H1961><s%> ha-ye-Tah has become כְּאַלְמָנָ֑ה <S%H490><s%> ke-'al-ma-Nah; [how] is she become as a widow רַבָּ֣תִי <S%H7227><s%> rab-Ba-ti she [that was] great בַגּוֹיִ֗ם <S%H1471><s%> vag-go-Yim, among the nations שָׂרָ֙תִי֙ <S%H8282><s%> sa-Ra-ti [and] princess בַּמְּדִינ֔וֹת <S%H4082><s%> bam-me-di-Not, among the provinces הָיְתָ֖ה <S%H1961><s%> ha-ye-Tah has become לָמַֽס׃ <S%H4522><s%> la-Mas. [how] is she become tributary ס sa-Mek

בָּכ֨וֹ <S%H1058><s%> ba-Cho She weepeth תִבְכֶּ֜ה <S%H1058><s%> tiv-Keh sore בַּלַּ֗יְלָה <S%H3915><s%> bal-Lay-lah, in the night וְדִמְעָתָהּ֙ <S%H1832><s%> ve-dim-'a-Tah and her tears עַ֣ל <S%H5921><s%> 'al are on לֶֽחֱיָ֔הּ <S%H3895><s%> le-che-Yah, [are] on her cheeks אֵֽין־ <S%H369><s%> 'ein- has לָ֥הּ lah מְנַחֵ֖ם <S%H5162><s%> me-na-Chem she hath none to comfort מִכָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> mik-kol all אֹהֲבֶ֑יהָ <S%H157><s%> 'o-ha-Vei-ha; among all her lovers כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- All רֵעֶ֙יהָ֙ <S%H7453><s%> re-'Ei-ha [her] all her friends בָּ֣גְדוּ <S%H898><s%> Ba-ge-du have dealt treacherously בָ֔הּ Vah, הָ֥יוּ <S%H1961><s%> Ha-yu have become לָ֖הּ <S%H99999><s%> lah לְאֹיְבִֽים׃ <S%H341><s%> le-'o-ye-Vim. with her they are become her enemies ס sa-Mek

גָּֽלְתָ֨ה <S%H1540><s%> gal-Tah is gone into captivity יְהוּדָ֤ה <S%H3063><s%> ye-hu-Dah Judah מֵעֹ֙נִי֙ <S%H6040><s%> me-'O-ni because of affliction וּמֵרֹ֣ב <S%H7230><s%> u-me-Ro and because of great עֲבֹדָ֔ה <S%H5656><s%> 'a-vo-Dah, servitude הִ֚יא <S%H1931><s%> hi She יָשְׁבָ֣ה <S%H3427><s%> ya-she-Vah she dwelleth בַגּוֹיִ֔ם <S%H1471><s%> vag-go-Yim, among the heathen לֹ֥א <S%H3808><s%> lo no מָצְאָ֖ה <S%H4672><s%> ma-tze-'Ah she findeth מָנ֑וֹחַ <S%H4494><s%> ma-No-ach; no rest כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- All רֹדְפֶ֥יהָ <S%H7291><s%> ro-de-Fei-ha all her persecutors הִשִּׂיג֖וּהָ <S%H5381><s%> his-si-Gu-ha overtook בֵּ֥ין <S%H996><s%> bein the midst הַמְּצָרִֽים׃ <S%H4712><s%> ham-me-tza-Rim. her between the straits ס sa-Mek

דַּרְכֵ֨י <S%H1870><s%> dar-Chei The ways צִיּ֜וֹן <S%H6726><s%> tzi-Yon of Zion אֲבֵל֗וֹת <S%H57><s%> a-ve-Lot, do mourn מִבְּלִי֙ <S%H1097><s%> mib-be-Li no בָּאֵ֣י <S%H935><s%> ba-'Ei because none come מוֹעֵ֔ד <S%H4150><s%> mo-'Ed, to the solemn feasts כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- All שְׁעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ <S%H8179><s%> she-'a-Rei-ha all her gates שֽׁוֹמֵמִ֔ין <S%H8074><s%> sho-me-Min, are desolate כֹּהֲנֶ֖יהָ <S%H3548><s%> ko-ha-Nei-ha her priests נֶאֱנָחִ֑ים <S%H584><s%> ne-'e-na-Chim; sigh בְּתוּלֹתֶ֥יהָ <S%H1330><s%> be-tu-lo-Tei-ha her virgins נּוּג֖וֹת <S%H3013><s%> nu-Got are afflicted וְהִ֥יא <S%H1931><s%> ve-Hi herself מַר־ <S%H4751><s%> mar- angry לָֽהּ׃ <S%H99999><s%> Lah. ס sa-Mek

הָי֨וּ <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yu have become צָרֶ֤יהָ <S%H6862><s%> tza-Rei-ha Her adversaries לְרֹאשׁ֙ <S%H7218><s%> le-roSh are the chief אֹיְבֶ֣יהָ <S%H341><s%> 'o-ye-Vei-ha her enemies שָׁל֔וּ <S%H7951><s%> sha-Lu, prosper כִּֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- For יְהוָ֥ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh for the LORD הוֹגָ֖הּ <S%H3013><s%> ho-Gah hath afflicted עַ֣ל <S%H5921><s%> 'al Because רֹב־ <S%H7230><s%> rov- her for the multitude פְּשָׁעֶ֑יהָ <S%H6588><s%> pe-sha-'Ei-ha; of her transgressions עוֹלָלֶ֛יהָ <S%H5768><s%> o-la-Lei-ha her children הָלְכ֥וּ <S%H1980><s%> ha-le-Chu are gone שְׁבִ֖י <S%H7628><s%> she-Vi into captivity לִפְנֵי־ <S%H6440><s%> lif-nei- before צָֽר׃ <S%H6862><s%> Tzar. the enemy ס sa-Mek

וַיֵּצֵ֥א <S%H3318><s%> vai-ye-Tze is departed; מִן־ <S%H4480><s%> min- at בת־ vat- כמִבַּת־ <S%H1323><s%> mib-bat- the daughter צִיּ֖וֹן <S%H1323><s%> tzi-Yon And from the daughter קכָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- All הֲדָרָ֑הּ <S%H1926><s%> ha-da-Rah; all her beauty הָי֣וּ <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yu have become שָׂרֶ֗יהָ <S%H8269><s%> sa-Rei-ha, her princes כְּאַיָּלִים֙ <S%H354><s%> ke-'ai-ya-Lim are become like harts לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- no מָצְא֣וּ <S%H4672><s%> ma-tze-'U [that] find מִרְעֶ֔ה <S%H4829><s%> mir-'Eh, no pasture וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ <S%H1980><s%> vai-ye-le-Chu have fled בְלֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> ve-lo- without כֹ֖חַ <S%H3581><s%> Cho-ach without strength לִפְנֵ֥י <S%H6440><s%> lif-Nei before רוֹדֵֽף׃ <S%H7291><s%> ro-Def. the pursuer ס sa-Mek

זָֽכְרָ֣ה <S%H2142><s%> za-che-Rah remembered יְרוּשָׁלִַ֗ם <S%H3389><s%> ye-ru-sha-Lim, Jerusalem יְמֵ֤י <S%H3117><s%> ye-Mei in the days עָנְיָהּ֙ <S%H6040><s%> 'a-ne-Yah of her affliction וּמְרוּדֶ֔יהָ <S%H4788><s%> u-me-ru-Dei-ha, and of her miseries כֹּ֚ל <S%H3605><s%> kol all מַחֲמֻדֶ֔יהָ <S%H4262><s%> ma-cha-mu-Dei-ha, all her pleasant things אֲשֶׁ֥ר <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher after הָי֖וּ <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yu were from מִ֣ימֵי <S%H3117><s%> Mi-mei that she had in the days קֶ֑דֶם <S%H6924><s%> Ke-dem; of old בִּנְפֹ֧ל <S%H5307><s%> bin-Fol fell עַמָּ֣הּ <S%H5971><s%> 'am-Mah when her people בְּיַד־ <S%H3027><s%> be-yad- into the hand צָ֗ר <S%H6862><s%> Tzar, of the enemy וְאֵ֤ין <S%H369><s%> ve-'Ein and no עוֹזֵר֙ <S%H5826><s%> o-Zer and none did help לָ֔הּ <S%H99999><s%> Lah, רָא֣וּהָ <S%H7200><s%> ra-'U-ha saw צָרִ֔ים <S%H6862><s%> tza-Rim, her the adversaries שָׂחֲק֖וּ <S%H7832><s%> sa-cha-Ku her [and] did mock עַ֥ל <S%H5921><s%> 'al at מִשְׁבַּתֶּֽהָ׃ <S%H4868><s%> mish-bat-Te-ha. at her sabbaths ס sa-Mek

חֵ֤טְא <S%H2399><s%> chet hath grievously חָֽטְאָה֙ <S%H2398><s%> cha-te-'Ah sinned יְר֣וּשָׁלִַ֔ם <S%H3389><s%> ye-Ru-sha-Lim, Jerusalem עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- and כֵּ֖ן <S%H3651><s%> ken after that לְנִידָ֣ה <S%H5206><s%> le-ni-Dah therefore she is removed הָיָ֑תָה <S%H1961><s%> ha-Ya-tah; has become כָּֽל־ <S%H3605><s%> kal- All מְכַבְּדֶ֤יהָ <S%H3513><s%> me-chab-be-Dei-ha all that honoured הִזִּיל֙וּהָ֙ <S%H2107><s%> hiz-zi-Lu-ha her despise כִּי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- her Because רָא֣וּ <S%H7200><s%> ra-'U her because they have seen עֶרְוָתָ֔הּ <S%H6172><s%> 'er-va-Tah, her nakedness גַּם־ <S%H1571><s%> gam- Even הִ֥יא <S%H1931><s%> hi herself נֶאֶנְחָ֖ה <S%H584><s%> ne-'en-Chah yea she sigheth וַתָּ֥שָׁב <S%H7725><s%> vat-Ta-shov and turneth אָחֽוֹר׃ <S%H268><s%> a-Chor. backward ס sa-Mek

טֻמְאָתָ֣הּ <S%H2932><s%> tum-'a-Tah Her filthiness בְּשׁוּלֶ֗יהָ <S%H7757><s%> be-shu-Lei-ha, [is] in her skirts לֹ֤א <S%H3808><s%> lo did not זָֽכְרָה֙ <S%H2142><s%> za-che-Rah she remembereth אַחֲרִיתָ֔הּ <S%H319><s%> 'a-cha-ri-Tah, not her last end וַתֵּ֣רֶד <S%H3381><s%> vat-Te-red therefore she came down פְּלָאִ֔ים <S%H6382><s%> pe-la-'Im, wonderfully אֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein has מְנַחֵ֖ם <S%H5162><s%> me-na-Chem she had no comforter לָ֑הּ Lah; רְאֵ֤ה <S%H7200><s%> re-'Eh behold יְהוָה֙ <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh O LORD אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- עָנְיִ֔י <S%H6040><s%> 'a-ne-Yi, my affliction כִּ֥י <S%H3588><s%> ki for הִגְדִּ֖יל <S%H1431><s%> hig-Dil hath magnified אוֹיֵֽב׃ <S%H341><s%> o-Yev. for the enemy ס sa-Mek

יָדוֹ֙ <S%H3027><s%> ya-Do his hand פָּ֣רַשׂ <S%H6566><s%> Pa-ras hath spread out צָ֔ר <S%H6862><s%> Tzar, The adversary עַ֖ל <S%H5921><s%> 'al Over כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all מַחֲמַדֶּ֑יהָ <S%H4261><s%> ma-cha-mad-Dei-ha; upon all her pleasant things כִּֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- for רָאֲתָ֤ה <S%H7200><s%> ra-'a-Tah for she hath seen גוֹיִם֙ <S%H1471><s%> go-Yim [that] the heathen בָּ֣אוּ <S%H935><s%> Ba-'u entered מִקְדָּשָׁ֔הּ <S%H4720><s%> mik-da-Shah, into her sanctuary אֲשֶׁ֣ר <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher whom צִוִּ֔יתָה <S%H6680><s%> tziv-Vi-tah, whom thou didst command לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- should not יָבֹ֥אוּ <S%H935><s%> ya-Vo-'u [that] they should not enter בַקָּהָ֖ל <S%H6951><s%> vak-ka-Hal into thy congregation לָֽךְ׃ <S%H99999><s%> Lach. ס sa-Mek

כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- All עַמָּ֤הּ <S%H5971><s%> 'am-Mah All her people נֶאֱנָחִים֙ <S%H584><s%> ne-'e-na-Chim sigh מְבַקְּשִׁ֣ים <S%H1245><s%> me-vak-ke-Shim they seek לֶ֔חֶם <S%H3899><s%> Le-chem, bread נָתְנ֧וּ <S%H5414><s%> na-te-Nu they have given; מַחֲמֹודֵּיהֶם ma-cha-mo-dei-hem כמַחֲמַדֵּיהֶ֛ם <S%H4262><s%> ma-cha-mad-dei-Hem pleasant thing קבְּאֹ֖כֶל <S%H400><s%> be-'O-chel for meat לְהָשִׁ֣יב <S%H7725><s%> le-ha-Shiv to relieve נָ֑פֶשׁ <S%H5315><s%> Na-fesh; the soul רְאֵ֤ה <S%H7200><s%> re-'Eh see יְהוָה֙ <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh O LORD וְֽהַבִּ֔יטָה <S%H5027><s%> ve-hab-Bi-tah, and consider כִּ֥י <S%H3588><s%> ki For הָיִ֖יתִי <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yi-ti I am זוֹלֵלָֽה׃ <S%H2151><s%> zo-le-Lah. for I am become vile ס sa-Mek

ל֣וֹא <S%H3808><s%> Lo nothing אֲלֵיכֶם֮ <S%H413><s%> 'a-lei-Chem to כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all עֹ֣בְרֵי <S%H5674><s%> oe-rei [Is it] nothing to you all ye that pass דֶרֶךְ֒ <S%H1870><s%> de-reCh along הַבִּ֣יטוּ <S%H5027><s%> hab-Bi-tu behold וּרְא֗וּ <S%H7200><s%> u-re-'U, and see אִם־ <S%H518><s%> 'im- if יֵ֤שׁ <S%H3426><s%> yesh if there be מַכְאוֹב֙ <S%H4341><s%> mach-'Ov any sorrow כְּמַכְאֹבִ֔י <S%H4341><s%> ke-mach-'o-Vi, like unto my sorrow אֲשֶׁ֥ר <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher Which עוֹלַ֖ל <S%H5953><s%> o-Lal which is done לִ֑י Li; אֲשֶׁר֙ <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher Which הוֹגָ֣ה <S%H3013><s%> ho-Gah hath afflicted יְהוָ֔ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh, unto me wherewith the LORD בְּי֖וֹם <S%H3117><s%> be-Yom [me] in the day חֲר֥וֹן <S%H2740><s%> cha-Ron of his fierce אַפּֽוֹ׃ <S%H639><s%> ap-Po. anger ס sa-Mek

מִמָּר֛וֹם <S%H4791><s%> mi-ma-Rom From above שָֽׁלַח־ <S%H7971><s%> sha-lach- hath he sent אֵ֥שׁ <S%H784><s%> 'esh fire בְּעַצְמֹתַ֖י <S%H6106><s%> be-'atz-mo-Tai into my bones וַיִּרְדֶּ֑נָּה <S%H7287><s%> vai-yir-Den-nah; and it prevaileth פָּרַ֨שׂ <S%H6566><s%> pa-Ras against them he hath spread רֶ֤שֶׁת <S%H7568><s%> Re-shet a net לְרַגְלַי֙ <S%H7272><s%> le-rag-Lai for my feet הֱשִׁיבַ֣נִי <S%H7725><s%> he-shi-Va-ni he hath turned אָח֔וֹר <S%H268><s%> a-Chor, me back נְתָנַ֙נִי֙ <S%H5414><s%> ne-ta-Na-ni he hath made שֹֽׁמֵמָ֔ה <S%H8076><s%> sho-me-Mah, desolate כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all הַיּ֖וֹם <S%H3117><s%> hai-Yom all the day דָּוָֽה׃ <S%H1739><s%> da-Vah. [and] faint ס sa-Mek

נִשְׂקַד֩ <S%H8244><s%> nis-Kad is bound עֹ֨ל <S%H5923><s%> 'ol The yoke פְּשָׁעַ֜י <S%H6588><s%> pe-sha-'Ai of my transgressions בְּיָד֗וֹ <S%H3027><s%> be-ya-Do, by his hand יִשְׂתָּ֥רְג֛וּ <S%H8276><s%> yis-Ta-re-Gu they are wreathed עָל֥וּ <S%H5927><s%> 'a-Lu [and] come up עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- upon צַוָּארִ֖י <S%H6677><s%> tzav-va-Ri upon my neck הִכְשִׁ֣יל <S%H3782><s%> hich-Shil to fall כֹּחִ֑י <S%H3581><s%> ko-Chi; he hath made my strength נְתָנַ֣נִי <S%H5414><s%> ne-ta-Na-ni hath delivered אֲדֹנָ֔י <S%H136><s%> 'a-do-Nai, the Lord בִּידֵ֖י <S%H3027><s%> bi-Dei me into [their] hands לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- am not אוּכַ֥ל <S%H3201><s%> 'u-Chal [from whom] I am not able קֽוּם׃ <S%H6965><s%> Kum. to rise up ס sa-Mek

סִלָּ֨ה <S%H5541><s%> sil-Lah hath trodden under foot כָל־ <S%H3605><s%> chol all אַבִּירַ֤י׀ <S%H47><s%> 'ab-bi-Rai all my mighty אֲדֹנָי֙ <S%H136><s%> 'a-do-Nai The Lord בְּקִרְבִּ֔י <S%H7130><s%> be-kir-Bi, [men] in the midst קָרָ֥א <S%H7121><s%> ka-Ra of me he hath called עָלַ֛י <S%H5921><s%> 'a-Lai against מוֹעֵ֖ד <S%H4150><s%> mo-'Ed an assembly לִשְׁבֹּ֣ר <S%H7665><s%> lish-Bor against me to crush בַּחוּרָ֑י <S%H970><s%> ba-chu-Rai; my young men גַּ֚ת <S%H1660><s%> gat [as] in a winepress דָּרַ֣ךְ <S%H1869><s%> da-Rach hath trodden אֲדֹנָ֔י <S%H136><s%> 'a-do-Nai, the Lord לִבְתוּלַ֖ת <S%H1330><s%> liv-tu-Lat the virgin בַּת־ <S%H1323><s%> bat- the daughter יְהוּדָֽה׃ <S%H3063><s%> ye-hu-Dah. of Judah ס sa-Mek
